text: is even happier that the smell of jasmine is wafting through the window AND Underworld is playing.
Is happy that it's warm enough to have the window open.
has found the perfect screen cleaner: "The disc doctors miracle record cleaner". It costs an arm and a leg but it works a charm!
Just off for a hike and a bit of a picnic lunch. Sky's looking a little grey though.
@freshtonic Networks of friends, they tend to follow a power law.
@declare. I don't understand!
Advice: don't start a conversation to people you don't know with: "That's intersting from a mathmatical point of view". Must get out more.
Is wondering if he can be arsed to implement suffix array at 1900 on a Saturday evening.
@freshtonic nice to see after so long :-)
@snapperwolf if you made people kill and butcher their own meat there would be a lot more vegetarians.
@snapperwolf is a bad man.
@lachlanhardy Thought nanowar was a cyberpunk novel. But it's a game. I'm not into games but I've just the last half hour playing it. Hmmm.
@lachlanhardy Congrats.
Bow down to the tofu god.
is grumpy he bit a stone in his breakfast and now has tooth ache. And it fucking hurts. And he can't get any drugs with enough opiates.
@lachlanhardy, and @maxine & @scenariogirl. that's very funny.
@hughevans Oh I will be!
Note to self. Don't make dinner and then sit on it.
notices that Sun are trying to take the L out of LAMP: http://tinyurl.com/yrycn8. No surprise there then.
@mdreid I've got all of Tricky's early stuff but then got bored; time to revist. The new Presets album is pretty bloody good as well.
eagerly awaits @vegemite_toast's first tweet.
thinks the new Portishead album is fantastic.
hates computers and is going to bed.
is trying to debug why net-ssh fails to authenticate using public/private key pairs when running in screen. But work when not in screen.
is wondering how on earth his LSI implementation doesnt work when he follows the literature but works really well when he doesn't. Worrying.
appears to be easily distracted this morning.
magnificant: http://tinyurl.com/5ofmz6
Yah for speed reading: http://www.spreeder.com/
is glad the Tour de France is over. He can get his life back.
Supermarkets: the home of dementors.
@benaskins Nice recommendation on the GenLevel track.
is reveling in the marvelousness of named_scopes in Rails 2.1
echo "set +H" >> $HOME/.bashrc. Now an unescaped ! won't eat my text. I'm very happy about that.
Frankie says: make sure you check your backups today. If you don't have backups, Frankie says do it. Do it now.
is very glad his git repo/vm machine has RAID 1. Very, very glad.
zf% folds a method (or paragraph depending on what document you're editing) in vim. I'm happy about that.
Why are there so many shiny things when I'm trying to work?
is happy that a new edition of New Scientist is out.
is wondering why the latest version of backgroundrb takes 200MB of real memory! This is four times the amount of the one I was using. Java?
The bad thing is you have no money and all your t-shirts have gapping holes in them.
The good thing about having your own business is you wake up on Wednesday thinking it's Thursday; when you realise it's Wednesday you go yah
would like to know if he says "There is no God" will he get a $1500 fine for harrassing Catholics?
Is just getting stuck into mocha.
@snapperwolf Nah.
"The point is men and dogs share a very short term memory": http://rubyurl.com/aGNw. I always wondered why that was!
doesn't really have anything to say.
has brain fog.
@snapperwolf I can imagine the headlines splashed accross the Tele:  "Dog roasted alive because owner is too lazy to turn off fire."
@noodlesue, @kathrynelliot is the beetroot queen.
The current state of timezones in ruby for non-US: broken. Very fucking broken.
I'm with @noodlesue on that one. Of course replacing the vegemite with marmite (real marmite that it is).
I can't deny it @KathrynElliott. Especially when each meal only cost 24c each.
is wondering if he should tell @snapperwolf that @KathrynElliott bought another very large cabbage.
This is just gold: http://rubyurl.com/MlRe. Particularly the bit about sexism.
Oh and listening to some very loud D&B. Which is probably why he's not going to bed. hehehe
Is doing some research on distributed filesystems. And wondering why he isn't in bed.
How depressing, Fance lost to Australia.
is *very* happy with his new replacement keyboard. Whilst the old one mostly worked after spilling a cup of sweet turkish coffer over it ...
@mdreid Bon voyage
It's nice to know there's a reason why I don't throw things away: http://rubyurl.com/BknZ
is hoping the restorative powers of cabbage soup are real.
is lying on the couch feeling pretty average.
Congratulations to the CouchDB guys for getting the 0.8 release out.
Just like to keep you on your toes @KathrynElliott
Where would be without http://rubyurl.com/eV0K
After talking about it at railscamp I'm just about to give haml a go.
is wishing his mouth ulcer would just stop hurting.
Just back from Railscamp. I had a great time, perhaps a little too much beer and not enough sleep.
If only I had neighbours stealing my bandwidth: http://tinyurl.com/yq9cur
My name is archaically spelt. Does that count?
@benaskins It also means rubbish as well.
Having a quick look at ragel. It may be slight overkill but it's pretty fucky.
is wondering why rubygems feels the need to download all required metadata *every* time it runs.
hating samba.
Chilly tofu and a side order of kimchi. Life's good.
Surely you're joking @noddlesue!
Moving away from the keyboard before I do any more damage.
@noodlesue seems a little harsh.
has been doing accounts.
is grumpy.
bed.
is so unbeliveably pissed off. I was watching "I am Legend" when the dvd died 16 minutes from the end. Not happy.
wonders if @snapperwolf has a job lot of cabbage to get through as well.
wonders if there might be some cabbage one-upmanship going on between @noodlesue and @kathrynelliott.
@mdreid I need to teach a document classifier on very limited data (at least initially) and was wondering if your work might be the ticket.
@mdreid "... I can send you a copy if you want." That would be great.
is listening to Hatful of Hollow on limited edition, numbered 10" vinyl. filterfish is  happy.
is wondering how long his graphics card in his mythtv box is going to last now he's taken the fan off!
is thinking of buying a portable shot-blasting machine and a stencil that says "Don't park in the fucking cycle lane".
needs to move to a warmer climate.
No surprise there then: http://rubyurl.com/mcn5
@mdreid It sounds like I might have to read your PHD thesis; it sounds applicable to what I'm doing at the moment.
You know when everythings gone to shit when you start make notes to youself that go like this: ensure psql -l | grep pn == true. <sig ...
@mdreid Now it's my turn to ask what you're working on? The conformal prediction looks really interesting.
is wondering how Vodafone defines "really soon".
Words that are mutually exclusive, such as male/female are call non-gradable antonyms. How cool is that!
Panicing.
In a bad mood after the cat sat on my laptop and turned it off. How the fuck she did it of is beyond me. All cats are evil.
@timriley Don't do it! mysql replication is evil. It will eat you first born and make smelly farts.
I'm struggling after the public holiday.
